intro: Silene pubicalycina, commonly known as the pubicalycine campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its hairy stems and showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Silene pubicalycina is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar botanical features.
